meanings.definition: To take for granted or without proof.
meanings.sent1: She assumed the answer was correct without checking.
meanings.sent2: He assumed the task would be easy.
meanings.sent3: The cat assumed the box was a new bed.
meanings.sent4: The sun assumed control of the sky at dawn.
meanings.sent5: The student assumed the teacher's explanation was accurate.

meanings.sent1: I assumed responsibility for the mistake.
meanings.sent2: She assumed the role of leader in the group project.
meanings.sent3: The dog assumed the duty of guarding the house.
meanings.sent4: The superhero assumed the mission to save the city.
meanings.sent5: He assumed the challenge of climbing the mountain.

meanings.sent1: The new manager assumed control of the team.
meanings.sent2: They assumed ownership of the abandoned house.
meanings.sent3: The robot assumed the task of cleaning the room.
meanings.sent4: The virus assumed control of the computer system.
meanings.sent5: The family assumed the stray kitten as their own.
